fun.connor.lighter

Interface Lighter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LighterUndertow

    public interface Lighter
    The Lighter inversion of control container. This class and it's associated builder are used for construction and interaction with the Lighter application server. Since Lighter behaves as a lightweight inversion of control system, this consists mostly of configuring the Lighter instance using the builder.
    All methods on the Lighter object are non-blocking. This allows the application developer to maintain flow control on the main thread. Lighter initializes it's own threads for running the backend webserver and the application defined endpoints.
    The Lighter instance itself does not use compile time generated code (or perform any classpath scan or reflection). Instead, Lighter uses plain Java interfaces to represent different forms of configuration. These can be written with different implementations for different application specific use cases. Lighter does come with automatic configuring implementations of these objects which are sufficent for most general use cases. For more details, see AutoConfigFactory.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Lighter.Builder
      The generic Builder interface for Lighter objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void start()
      Start the Lighter application server.
      void stop()
      Stop the Lighter application server.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start()
        Start the Lighter application server. This method will return immediately after the server has been started. This method causes Lighter to start its own pool of threads which will immediately start serving requests.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stop the Lighter application server. Ends all background threads that the container may be maintaining
